RMP Report for Land View Fertilizer (Minidoka)
Executive Summary


Land View Fertilizer, Inc. has an emergency response plan with the local fire department, the local emergency planning committee, and the State of Idaho emergency response committee.  The emergency response plan is reviewed and updated on an annual basis.  Included within our emergency action plan are the following sub categories:  Evacuation Plan, First Aid, Haz/Com (Employee right to Know) Fire Prevention and Protection, Lockout/Tagout, Powered Industrial Vehicles, Management Information, Personal Protection, General Workplace Safety, Electrical Safety, Confined Space Entry, and DOT and Fleet Safety.  Land View Fertilizer, Inc. subscribes and contracts with J. Connors and Associates to be in compliance with all local, state and federal regulations.

Land View Fertilizer, Inc. has several people within the company who are hazwhopper trained and certified.  Land View Fertilizer, Inc. participates in monthly employee safety meetings and training programs.  Land View Fertilizer, Inc. has a strong commitment to stewardship all of the products we sell.  In the history of Land View Fertilizer, Inc. we have not had any accidental releases of Anhydrous Ammonia. (NH3).  Land View Fertilizer, Inc. remains committed to staying abreast of current regulations, and local community needs.

Listed below is a statement from senior management that is posted throughout the company.  


Management Commitment Statement


The management of this company is committed to ensuring all employees are provided employment free of safety and health hazards and a safe and healthy workplace.  To this end, management will solicit and encourage employee involvement in the development and implementation of our safety program.

All employees are responsible for complying with all applicable safety rules implemented as part of this program.  This includes supervisors and other management personnel.

While we intend to operate our safety

program in a proactive, positive environment, all employees may be subject to disciplinary action for failure to comply with all applicable safety rules implemented as part of this program.  This includes supervisors and other management personnel.

Our program will seek to identify all safety and health hazards present in all work areas at this facility through regular inspections and employee input.  Management requires all employees to immediately report any actual or suspected safety or health hazards to their supervisor or other responsible person or by any approved, established procedures.

Management will determine what PPE is necessary and will provide equipment as required by the hazards identified in accordance with OSHA regulations.  Employees are required to wear all prescribed PPE and to follow proper care and use instructions.

Management will provide employee training to make employees aware of the actual and potential safety and health hazards present in the workplace and to assist employees in their efforts to work safely. Employees are required to attend safety training sessions as instructed, to listen attentively to the information presented, and to ask questions about any information not clear or understood.

Our safety and health program will only succeed if both management and labor personnel participated and support all necessary measures.




Land View Fertilizer, Inc.
Executive Management
